title: Private Health Screening

cta.subtitle: Limited slots each morning to guarantee privacy and attention.
cta.title: Reserve Your Health Screening

overview.title: What the Screening Includes
overview.content: Full medical history, vitals, BMI, ECG, spirometry, urinalysis, 40+ blood markers (lipids, hormones, thyroid, vitamins, diabetes risk), and optional cancer markers. We also include a lifestyle debrief with nutrition and stress guidance.
highlights: Consultant GP for the entire appointment
Digital and printed report within 2 working days

seo.metaTitle: Private Health Screening London | Comprehensive Medicals | Dr. SNA Clinic
seo.metaDescription: Book male or female private health checks with blood tests, cardiac screening, and lifestyle coaching in Marylebone.

schema.howPerformed: Your comprehensive health screening spans 90-120 minutes in our spa-like diagnostics suite. Dr. Abbas begins with an in-depth consultation covering your medical history, family history, lifestyle, diet, stress levels, sleep quality, and health goals. This is followed by a full physical examination including cardiovascular assessment, respiratory function, abdominal palpation, and screening for common conditions. Our experienced phlebotomist then takes blood samples for a comprehensive panel of 40+ biomarkers including full blood count, liver and kidney function, lipid profile (cholesterol, triglycerides, HDL, LDL), HbA1c (diabetes), thyroid function (TSH, T3, T4), vitamin D, B12, folate, iron studies, testosterone (for men), hormones (for women), inflammatory markers (CRP), and optional cancer markers (PSA, CA125). Additional tests include 12-lead ECG to assess heart rhythm and electrical activity, spirometry for lung function, urinalysis, blood pressure monitoring, BMI and body composition analysis, and optional add-ons like DEXA bone density scan, cardiac CT calcium scoring, or whole-body MRI. All results are reviewed personally by Dr. Abbas who provides a detailed interpretation, risk assessment, and personalized action plan
schema.preparation: Fast for 10-12 hours before your appointment (water okay, no food or drinks with calories). Take regular medications unless advised otherwise. Avoid intense exercise for 24 hours before. Bring a list of current medications, supplements, and family medical history. Wear comfortable, loose clothing for examination. Arrive well-rested. Book your screening for a morning slot when fasting is easier. If adding imaging, we'll provide specific preparation instructions
schema.followup: Receive your comprehensive digital report within 48-72 hours containing all test results with reference ranges and Dr. Abbas's detailed commentary. A follow-up consultation (video or in-person) is scheduled to review findings, discuss any abnormalities, and create your personalized wellness roadmap. This includes nutritional recommendations, exercise prescription, supplement protocols, stress management strategies, and any referrals to specialists if concerning findings arise. Lifestyle coaching and accountability check-ins available. Annual or biannual repeat screenings recommended to track trends and catch changes early
schema.outcome: Gain complete clarity about your current health status and risk factors for future disease. Identify hidden problems before they cause symptoms—early detection of prediabetes, high cholesterol, thyroid dysfunction, vitamin deficiencies, hormonal imbalances, or cardiac risk factors allows for intervention before serious complications develop. Receive a personalized roadmap to optimize health, longevity, and performance. Peace of mind from knowing you've been thoroughly assessed by an experienced physician. Tracking biomarkers year-on-year allows you to measure progress and catch subtle changes. Executive clients report improved energy, focus, and productivity after addressing deficiencies and optimizing lifestyle. Many preventable diseases caught early through screening
schema.medicationRequired: None required for screening itself. Medications or supplements may be recommended based on findings
schema.treatmentFrequency: Annual health screening recommended for adults over 40, those with family history of disease, or high-stress professionals. Biannual (every 6 months) for those with existing conditions or undergoing optimization protocols
schema.adverseOutcome: Minimal—some patients experience slight bruising at blood draw site. Anxiety if unexpected abnormalities found (we provide clear guidance and prompt specialist referral). Very rarely, false positive results requiring repeat testing
contraindication: Severe needle phobia (we can discuss alternatives or arrange sedation)
Active illness or infection (reschedule when well for accurate baseline)
Recent major surgery (wait 6-8 weeks for accurate markers)
typicalTest: Comprehensive blood panel (40+ biomarkers including metabolic, hormonal, nutritional, inflammatory markers)
Optional add-ons: DEXA bone scan, cardiac CT calcium scoring, whole-body MRI, carotid ultrasound, cancer markers
clinicalFindings: Preventive health assessment for asymptomatic individuals
Family history of cardiovascular disease, diabetes, or cancer
Lifestyle-related health concerns (stress, poor diet, sedentary work)
